comment: I liked having him as a teacher. I really enjoyed learning about the 7 habits. He is very passionate about teaching and his classes. He could get off topic sometimes and could be a bit confusing, but not too bad.

Notes are very vague, but come straight from the book. All tests and quizzes are straight from the book and the practice questions in the book. Attendance not mandatory but having less than 3 absences boosts your grade by 1 point. 4 tests, drops the lowest one. Two 2-page papers. 4 quizzes. And 3 hour research experience. He's alright I guess.

Good professor. Book used to review and complete study guides. Information can be very vague. Talks about his motorcycles and his crazy wife a lot. Gives four exams, drops one. Has quizzes but they aren't bad. Overall a good professor.

He is very nice and very laid back. You pretty much just do 7 habits the whole time and he is the easiest grader in the world. We only had two tests and they were kind of hard but other then that his class is super easy.
Great professor.  Very interesting. Just read the material and take good notes.  Provides outline and study guide.  COME TO CLASS.  You will enjoy this course.

We had a semester long project that he never talked about. He is obsessed with the 7 habits and makes is course about it. You have to buy the text book, and he only uses it for the first week. Waste of money on the text book. Would not recommend if you want clarity..

Never met a teacher who talked so much about their personal life especially when no student cares! There were a couple of test questions about his wife.. Class material wasn't too bad, I found it an easy A and the work was not time consuming. Anyone failing this class probably shouldn't be in college.

Every class is powerpt. w/ video clip.HIS EXAM QUESTIONS ARE FROM THE TEXTBOOK MAKER'S TEST BANK. USE THE BOOK WEBSITE QUIZZES & THE PRACTICE TESTS AT THE END OF EACH CHP. 1 grade pt avg. curve if you miss less than 3 days. 3 Exams,40pt research participation online, 4 quizzes(easy), 2 one pg reflection papers (easy). Use the book website!!!!!!

Attendance does not count against your grade but less than 3 absences can mean a grade boost. Tests were a little challenging, but mostly out of the book. He is an easy grader on papers and other assignments. He is extremely nice and lenient. Class discussions were helpful/interesting. I'd definitely take him again.

Well, he uses alot of power points and does alot of lectures, but some of his assignments are just stupid. He also loves motorcycles and birds more than anything so you will hear him talk about them alot. Study for the tests and attend class and you should do fine.

DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY!!!! Grover's class is actually one of my hardest classes! he is very repetative, and is constantly talking about motorcycles, and birds. His tests are ridiculously hard, and he prides himself in the fact that he ruined some girls 4.0!! I found it impossible to sit through his class! worst class EVER!!!

his class has a lot of work involved, but if you show up and don't sleep you will do good in his class.  He has a lot of guest speakers to help freshmen out on things like registration, and the writting lab.  You have to care about your grades to do good in his class!

this class is required to take as  a freshman so there's really no getting around it. but he assigns way too much work including ten hours of volunteer work. he repeats himself; his class is extremely boring he talks about his birds and scooter all the time and is useless if asking for help he just ignores you. he's a nice guy but i hate his class.
